definition: one's own flesh and blood (idiom); closely related
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian

sentences.english: Education and knowledge has close inner relationship.
sentences.chinese: 教育与知识有着血肉相连的内在关系。

sentences.english: We are always as close as flesh and Blood.
sentences.chinese: 该工会与工人是血肉相连的。

sentences.english: The family is a deeply emotional, is a treasure beyond time and space.
sentences.chinese: 亲情是一种血肉相连的情感，是一笔超越时空的财富。
因为我们不仅仅是血肉相连。

definition: to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
blood is thicker than water/fig. family ties are closer than social relations
to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
flesh and blood/one's offspring
lit. interrelated as bones and flesh (idiom); inseparably related/closely intertwined
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
closely interrelated/intimately related
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
blood relation/kin/one's flesh and blood
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
kin/blood relation
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
to be interdependent
